title: ChiBitCTy
author: ChiBitCTy
content: Sitting here at home watching my alma matter Southern Illinois University (Salukis) face off against Missouri State in “Arch Madness” which is the Missouri Valley Conference Tournament. The winner of this game automatically gets a trip to the NCAA Tournament, and my Saukis haven’t gone in quite a few years so this game is stressful (pulled off the victory 54-51)Gearing up for the NCAA tournament and doing lots of gambling! I’m considering putting a pool together, so if anyone’s interested in participating, please let me know. If you’re unfamiliar with how that works, you simply pick the winner of each game all the way through to the championship game. There’s plenty of platforms that make doing this really easy, like Yahoo. Buy-in would be something small like .001BTCThis thread is also just to discuss the tournament that starts soon! ( Tuesday, March 14th )

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: I would be interested in this. How many participants do you feel we need for a minimum number here? 4? This year I expect to see alot of upsets in the 1st round as noone is really dominating the NCAA currently.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.created_time: March 04, 2023, 06:52:51 AMLast edit: March 04, 2023, 06:50:22 PM by ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on March 04, 2023, 06:35:50 AMI would be interested in this. How many participants do you feel we need for a minimum number here? 4? This year I expect to see alot of upsets in the 1st round as noone is really dominating the NCAA currently. Awesome! I know we could get Wheelz involved. Maybe Hhampuz. So 3 for sure. I’d say 4 would make it still fun. I imagine between us 3 we can drum up at least 1-2 more people each.  YYeah that’s what I love about this year, Kentucky or N Carolina not just absolutely dominating. I expect a good amount of upsets as well. I don’t know if my school will make the tourney but I get up an Illini fan, hoping for them to make a decent run.

When do you think you'll have all the details? We would Need to make our accounts and picks shortly after selection Sunday on March 14th. Games start on 16th(not sure if the 1st 4 are on the bracket, if they are then games start 14th).

Apologies, my dog passed a few days ago so I've been pretty out of it.  I will get this set up by this weekend.

Apologies, my dog passed a few days ago so I've been pretty out of it.  I will get this set up by this weekend. Sorry to hear this. You don't have to set it up if you do not feel like it. There is a bracket in games and rounds put up by betcoin.ag. Of course if you are going to set it up I will still participate as will others hopefully. You might create a thread in Games & rounds to garner interest and update with links to yahoo when created. Let me know and sorry to hear about your dog.

First off dude I'm really sorry about your dog.  Mine is like one of my kids, pain in the ass but would do anything for them.  Tough go man, my sympathy for you.With the tourney yeah man I'm in, best "playoffs" of any major sport ever.  If someone hasn't watched you should!  I usually take off for the first weekend just to watch 12 straight house of college ball, wife loves that weekend lol.Count me in and possibly 1 or 2 others for family and one of my friends.  Let me know what I need to do.

comments.author: wheelz1200
comments.body: Quick question do we need to be in before the Tuesday play in games or does this touny start when they are down to 64 on Thursday at 12pm est?  I've been in pools where they count the playin and then some that wait.  I will set mine up after the brackets have been set tomorrow night.  Best couple weeks of basketball incoming!!

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: wheelz1200 on March 11, 2023, 05:18:28 PMQuick question do we need to be in before the Tuesday play in games or does this touny start when they are down to 64 on Thursday at 12pm est?  I've been in pools where they count the playin and then some that wait.  I will set mine up after the brackets have been set tomorrow night.  Best couple weeks of basketball incoming!!Good question, I’m not sure. I’ll try and find that out but not sure I’ll be able to find out until the seedlings are set. It definitely is the best couple weeks of basketball. I’ve never not watch the first and second day of games all day while working. Makes those days so much more fun.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Can’t wait for the games to start tomorrow! I have been meaning to install a TV in my office at home but have been lazy so this was good motivation to get me to finally set it up. Rooting for Purdue personally. Their coach Matt Painter was the coach for Southern Illinois University when I went to school there (during our run of 6 straight tournament bids as well as 2 sweet sixteen appearances) so I’ve been rooting for him ever since. One hell of a coach! FINAL REMINDER- if anyone is interested there’s still time to sign up to be in our Yahoo pool- info here - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5444636.msg61901734#msg61901734

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.created_time: March 17, 2023, 04:40:02 AMLast edit: March 17, 2023, 05:49:50 AM by AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: The tournament is finally underway and we are having our first big upset already.Arizona lost by 4 vs Princeton, as a 15 point favourite to win the game. They had a lead of 12 points with 12min to play and led the whole game, then didn't score the final 5min. That's when they lost the lead and the game.Virginia falling to Furman was also a little surprising but not as big of an upset as Furman was only a 6 point underdog. Though, I didn't expect that to happen. Furman had a good season though.The ending was surely crazy: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAAsaXX3GYo16 games down today and 2 upsets, the rest were mostly favourite wins and some wins of small handicap underdogs.Let's see what day 2 will have in store for us.

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.created_time: March 18, 2023, 09:05:38 AMLast edit: March 18, 2023, 09:18:53 AM by AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Day 2 of the madness had one of the biggest upsets in history of the tournament with 25 point underdog Fairleigh Dickinson beating Purdue 63:58 .Entering Friday, 16-seeds were 1-150 in the opening round.I mean on day 1 Arizona was already heavy as they obviously had the game under control and still lost.But Purdue (ranked 3rd in the nation) losing to Fairleigh Dickinson is definitely another level of crazy..On my bracket I had Purdue to win the whole thing, hahaha.Well it's called march madness for a reason.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on March 18, 2023, 09:05:38 AMDay 2 of the madness had one of the biggest upsets in history of the tournament with 25 point underdog Fairleigh Dickinson beating Purdue 63:58 .Entering Friday, 16-seeds were 1-150 in the opening round.I mean on day 1 Arizona was already heavy as they obviously had the game under control and still lost.But Purdue (ranked 3rd in the nation) losing to Fairleigh Dickinson is definitely another level of crazy..On my bracket I had Purdue to win the whole thing, hahaha.Well it's called march madness for a reason.Lol you're right, there's a reason it's called March "madness".  Man my bracket completely busted by midway day 2.  I also had Purdue as the champion (as I've stated before he's the former coach of my alma mater Southern Illinois University.  As Yahoo had stated early on, this should be one of the best tournaments in a long time since so many teams are equally competitive .  I am in dead last place in my work league. Kind of embarrassing being that I actually know sports quite well, much more so than most of my co-workers who are doing much better than I am lol.  Ahh well, such is March Madness.

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Did anybody else watch Gonzaga vs UCLA? Game finished 2 min ago.What a game! Gonzaga down 13 at halftime, then comeback and led by 9 with 80 seconds to go. 12 seconds to go UCLA hits a 3 to get a miracle 76:75 lead just to get stung in the heart by a 3 from Gonzaga.This ending was really something else, that's why we love college basketball!

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on March 24, 2023, 04:27:34 AMDid anybody else watch Gonzaga vs UCLA? Game finished 2 min ago.What a game! Gonzaga down 13 at halftime, then comeback and led by 9 with 80 seconds to go. 12 seconds to go UCLA hits a 3 to get a miracle 76:75 lead just to get stung in the heart by a 3 from Gonzaga.This ending was really something else, that's why we love college basketball!I watched a little bit of that game, especially the ending.  One heck of a game.  At this point though my brackets are so busted it's turned me off of the tournament a bit.  I have never been knocked out of all my brackets so quick and simultaneously as I did this year.  One heck of a tournament though.  As Yahoo and I had been discussing before, the parity between the teams was quite high this year so it's actually been one of the best years I can remember in a long time!

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Another crazy day is gone and all number 1's are officially out.Never seen a tournament like this before with so many upsets. But of course this just makes it more exciting!Gonzaga vs Uconn will be the most even game in the elite 8 with both teams having good chances to advance. In the other games I am hoping for some more upsets, wouldn't it be fun to see San Diego State or Miami FL in the Final four?Of course the biggest surprise would be if somehow Florida Atlantic could advance, there is still a decent chance of beating Kansas state for yet another big win, everything is possible.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Yeah it’s been one heck of a tournament so far.  It seems like it’s not all that often that a number one seed , or at least one number one seed doesn’t at least make it to the final four. Again a testament to how well rounded this tournament really was.My teams certainly didn’t fare well this year, and my brackets crashed way early. Sooo, that wasn’t so fun.Looks like Yahoo won the pool challenge, congrats.
